intent_atoms.description: As a user, I want the detail pane stack to render metadata, validation issues, and hex slices for the selected box so that I can inspect information in a unified view.
Selecting a node produces a metadata detail view populated from ParseTreeSnapshot descriptors, including MP4RA-backed field labels.
Validation issues associated with the node render in a dedicated section with severity badges and copy‑to‑clipboard support.
Hex inspector shows a bounded payload window (configurable size) that stays synchronized with selection changes and shares snapshot timestamps for latency diagnostics.
Detail + hex panes update within 200 ms of incoming events during live parsing, matching tree updates.
The detail pane stack must preserve separation between presentation (SwiftUI views) and derived state (view models).
Reuse Combine snapshot models from C1/C2 and extend them with convenience accessors for metadata fields and payload slices.
Coordinate with planned hex slice provider work by defining protocols now and backing with simple file range requests until dedicated caching lands.
